description.narrative: After the recent release of the sixth IPCC report, there is no more room for discussion: The world needs radical change, now. As the attention of our political leaders shifts from one crisis to the other, the looming climate crisis is continuously pushedto the background. A record-breaking amount of CO2 has been pumped into the air in 2021 and with current policies the world is on a collisioncourse with a global average heating of 2.7 degrees: an absolute catastrophe. Amongst the most affected by this crisis are communities in the global South, the poor and marginalized and non-humans (biodiversity) alike, while their contribution to the problem is very small if none at all. To remain below a relatively ‘safe’ global heating of 1.5 degrees, as was agreed upon in the Paris accord,a swift and just transition is required. Since the people in power do not seem to make haste with this transition, it is of essencethat citizens rise united, confront their governments, and demand climate justice. As a grassroots movement, Extinction Rebellion’score strategy is mobilizing the masses to protest the climate- and ecological crisis and since 2018 it has proven to be successful in doing so. The Dutch chapter organizes actions all year round but concentrates its efforts twice a year (in spring- and autumn time), during a so-called ‘rebellion’. During a rebellion, the entire movement collaborates to produce mass actions, to capture the media's attention for, on average, the duration of a week. During such a rebellion, the movement concentrates its efforts to mobilize the greatest amount of ‘rebels’ on the streets, draws continued attention from national and local media, reaches out to- and informs the general public of the Netherlands, and organizes a 'community program' with workshops, discussions, an opportunity for regeneration and activist support. With highly visible, creative, and sometimes disruptive actions, XR NL puts a halt to ‘business as usual’.A rebellion is often centered around one, or a combination of the three core demands of XR NL: 1) Tell the truth; 2) Act now; 3) Let citizens decide. The extra funding allocated to these rebellions ensures that income generated through other activities can be invested in other, more structural, but equallyimportant elements of the movement.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: CSOs have strengthened capacity (and maintain and expand their civic space) to engage local, nationally and internationally in influencing on gendered climate justice, natural resources and/or land rights issues in an effective and inclusive way.
CSOs who demonstrate strengthened capacity to engage in influencing
Empowered women, men and (indigenous) communities promote, claim and defend their rights in relation to climate justice, natural resources and land rights.
human rights defenders protected by Oxfam/partners and/or able to continue their work
men that speak out, take action and claim their rights as a result of activities supported by Oxfam or partners.
women that speak out, take action and claim their rights as a result of activities supported by Oxfam or partners.
